repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: Personal Papers of East Asian Historian and UAlbany faculty member. Includes lecture notes and documentation of the East Asian and International programs, as well as Ellinwood's service on senate committees and Phi Beta Kappa.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: DeWitt Ellinwood was a Professor of East Asian History at the State University of New York at Albany. Ellinwood taught as a member of the History Department from 1962 until his retirement in 1992. He also served as the founding president of the Phi Beta Kappa chapter the University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes Ellinwood's lecture notes, documentation on course enrollment for the History Department and East Asian programs, as well as files he maintained on University Senate committees and Phi Beta Kappa.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection was maintained in the original order after it was transferred.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives in 1989 and 1996.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.
